definition: to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
to set a price/to fix a price
to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price

sentences.english: She bought a coat that had been knocked down to half-price.
sentences.chinese: 她买了一件降了一半价的衣服。

sentences.english: Honestly speaking, they are worth it. I will take the animals away with me at once.
sentences.chinese: 老实讲，它们得要这个价，我这就把牛牵走。

sentences.english: But I can beat the price. How about 29,000 Yuan?
sentences.chinese: 但我可以卖得比这个价便宜，29，000如何？

sentences.english: No one can quote you a price lower than mine.
sentences.chinese: 谁的报价也不会比我报的价更低。

sentences.english: Shares in Sears are still trading well below where they were last November.
sentences.chinese: 西尔斯股票的交易价仍远低于去年11月。
你能猜得出是什么价吗？

sentences.english: Therefore, we can increase the price a bit.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我们可以稍微提点价。

sentences.english: I asked him to set a value on the pictures.
sentences.chinese: 我请他对这些画估个价。

sentences.english: That figure is equal to 36% of the deal's value.
sentences.chinese: 这笔费用相当于交易价的36%。

sentences.english: At this point, the auction is the fairest and most easy to pull the ad valorem transaction.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上，拍卖是最公平和最容易拉广告价交易。

sentences.english: Barrick’s shares fell sharply after the bid was revealed.
sentences.chinese: 当标的价被公开后，巴里克股价急速下跌。

sentences.english: So, let's say we're asked for the plus two ion.
sentences.chinese: 我们说我们被要求解2价正离子。

sentences.english: Please quote us on one of your engine as advertised; your quotation is to include delivery and erection in Osaka.
sentences.chinese: 请告知您广告中的发动机大阪交货价，并包括安装费。

sentences.english: Right now you just want estimates.
sentences.chinese: 现在你只是需要估量价。

sentences.english: All the prices are on the FOB shanghai agreement.
sentences.chinese: 所有的代价都是上海港船上交货价。

sentences.english: Please quote your price on FOB basis, indicating the postage for dispatch by parcel post to Shaihai via Guangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 请报船上交货价，并说明将包裹经广州至上海的邮费。

definition: to set a price/to fix a price
to sell/to make or carry out (a plan or intrigue etc)
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
